description: From Latin adscriptus, past participle of adscribere (“to enroll”). See ascribe.

entries.meaning: Held to service as attached to the soil; said of feudal serfs.
A feudal serf or labourer who is attached to an estate and sold or transferred with it.
(typography) Something written or printed immediately after another character and aligned with it.

verbs.description: adscript (third-person singular simple present adscripts, present participle adscripting, simple past and past participle adscripted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To hold (a person) to service as attached to the soil; said of feudal serfs.
